name: The Ultimate Cleveland Cavaliers Quiz |   NBA Teams

questions.text: Where did the Cleveland Cavaliers play their home games in 2010-11?
questions.explanation:
Quicken Loans Arena.

	Quicken Loans Arena is also known as 'The Q'.

questions.text: When was the Cavaliers first season in the NBA?
questions.explanation:
1970-71.

	Their first season in 1970-71 wasn't very impressive with their 15-67 record.  Their 1975-76 season was their first finishing over .500.

questions.text: What year was Mark Price drafted in?
questions.explanation:
1986.

	Mark Price was the 25th pick in the second round.  He played from 1986 to 1998.  Price went to Georgia Tech, and when his career was over he coached high school basketball.

questions.text: Which conference do the Cavaliers play in?
questions.explanation:
Eastern.

	The Eastern Conference contains the Boston Celtics, New York Knicks, New Jersey Nets, Philadelphia 76ers, Toronto Raptors, Atlanta Hawks, Charlotte Bobcats, Miami Heat, Orlando Magic, Washington Wizards, Chicago Bulls, Cleveland Cavaliers, Detroit Pistons, Indiana Pacers, and the Milwaukee Bucks.

questions.text: Who was their first coach from 1970-1979?
questions.explanation:
Bill Fitch.

	Bill Fitch coached in both the NCAA and the NBA from 1956-1988, while coaching the Cavaliers from 1970-1979.  He was born in 1934 in Iowa and went to Coe College.

questions.text: Who was Cleveland's first All-Star Game selectee?
questions.explanation:
John Johnson.

	John Johnson was drafted in 1970.  He scored 11,200 career points. He was selected to the All-Star game in 1971, then again in 1972 with Butch Beard.

questions.text: Mark Price had his jersey retired as a Cavalier on November 13, 1999.  His jersey was the ______ jersey retired by the club.
questions.explanation:
6th.

	The retired jerseys before Price was the number 7 of Bingo Smith, the 22 of Larry Nance, the 34 of Austin Carr, Nate Thurmond's 42, and the 43 of Brad Daugherty.  Price wore the number 25.

questions.text: What position did Brad Daugherty play?
questions.explanation:
Center.

	Brad played the majority of his career at the center position from 1986-1994.  Daugherty was selected to five All-Star teams.  He retired in 1994, then went into broadcasting.

questions.text: Who was the first Cavalier to go to the slam dunk contest?
questions.explanation:
Roy Hinson.

	Roy Hinson played power forward and center.  He appeared in the contest in 1986, finishing seventh of eight players.  He played three of his eight seasons for the Cavs from 1983-1991.
